original_definition: 'frequency recovery range' means the system frequency range to which the system frequency is expected to return in the GB and IE/NI synchronous areas, after the occurrence of an imbalance equal to or smaller than the reference incident, within the time to recover frequency;
generated_definition: 'frequency recovery range' means a range of frequency deviation values within which the instantaneous frequency is expected to recover to its nominal value after a disturbance, and within which the frequency deviation is not considered to be out of control.

Article 3: ‘frequency recovery range’ means thesystem frequencyrange to which the system frequency is expected to return in the GB and IE/NI synchronous areas, after the occurrence of an imbalance equal to or smaller than thereference incident, within the time to recover frequency;

‘frequency recovery range’ means the system frequency range to which the system frequency is expected to return in the GB and IE/NI synchronous areas, after the occurrence of an imbalance equal to or smaller than the reference incident, within the time to recover frequency;
Article 127: the frequency recovery range for the GB and IE/NI synchronous areas; and
Article 131: for the GB and IE/NI synchronous areas, the number of events for which the absolute value of theinstantaneous frequency deviationwas outside of thefrequency recovery range and was not returned to the frequency recovery range within the time to recover frequency, distinguishing between negative and positive frequency deviations;
